content:
I think I'll try to focus on my breath and body sensations to anchor myself in the present moment. If my mind starts to wander or I get distracted by the noise or crowds, I'll gently bring my attention back to my breath or body sensations. I might also try to use the noise and crowds as a reminder to stay present, rather than getting frustrated or annoyed.

As for my phone, I'll make sure to put it on silent mode and try to resist the urge to check notifications or scroll through social media during my mindfulness practice. If I do get a notification or feel the urge to check my phone, I'll acknowledge the thought and gently bring my attention back to my breath or body sensations.

I've also been thinking about how I can apply mindfulness to other areas of my life, such as when I'm interacting with others or making decisions. Do you have any tips on how to incorporate mindfulness into my daily interactions and decision-making processes?
